intro: Pariana maynensis, commonly known as the Maynensian pariana, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are ovate with a smooth margin and are often used in traditional medicine by local communities.
